intro: Eremopyrum bonaepartis var. aristatum, commonly known as the aristate eremopyrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, two-lobed flowers. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. This variety is notable for its distinctive leaf tips, which are usually elongated and pointed.
